member.name: T:Asp.Versioning.ApiExplorer.ApiVersionDescription
member.summary: Represents the description of an API version.

member.name: M:Asp.Versioning.ApiExplorer.ApiVersionDescription.#ctor(Asp.Versioning.ApiVersion,System.String,System.Boolean,Asp.Versioning.SunsetPolicy)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The group name for the API version.
Indicates whether the API version is deprecated.
The defined sunset policy, if any.

member.name: P:Asp.Versioning.ApiExplorer.ApiVersionDescription.ApiVersion
member.summary: Gets the described API version.
member.value: The described API version.

member.name: P:Asp.Versioning.ApiExplorer.ApiVersionDescription.GroupName
member.summary: Gets the API version group name.
member.value: The group name for the API version.

member.name: P:Asp.Versioning.ApiExplorer.ApiVersionDescription.IsDeprecated
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the API version is deprecated.
member.value: True if the API version is deprecated; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: An API version will only be described as deprecated when all all corresponding service implementations are also deprecated. It is possible that some API versions may be partially deprecated, in which case this property will return false, but individual actions may report that they are deprecated.

member.name: P:Asp.Versioning.ApiExplorer.ApiVersionDescription.SunsetPolicy
member.summary: Gets described API sunset policy.
member.value: The defined sunset policy defined for the API, if any.

member.name: T:Asp.Versioning.ErrorObjectJsonOptionsSetup
member.summary:
Adds the ErrorObjectJsonContext to the current JsonSerializerOptions.
This allows for consistent serialization behavior for ErrorObject regardless if the default reflection-based serializer is used and makes it trim/NativeAOT compatible.

member.name: P:Asp.Versioning.IApiVersioningFeature.RequestedApiVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the API version for the current request.

member.remarks: If an API version was not provided for the current request or the value provided is invalid, this property will return null.

member.summary: Represents an API version reader that reads the value from a media type HTTP header in the request.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: This constructor always uses the "v" media type parameter.

member.name: M:Asp.Versioning.MediaTypeApiVersionReader.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The name of the media type parameter to read the API version from.

member.name: P:Asp.Versioning.MediaTypeApiVersionReader.ParameterName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the media type parameter to read the API version from.
member.value: The name of the media type parameter to read the API version from. The default value is "v".

member.name: M:Asp.Versioning.MediaTypeApiVersionReader.ReadAcceptHeader(System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue})
member.summary: Reads the requested API version from the HTTP Accept header.
member.param: The collection of Accept headers to read from.
member.returns: The API version read or null.
member.remarks: The default implementation will return the first defined API version ranked by the media type quality parameter.

member.name: M:Asp.Versioning.MediaTypeApiVersionReader.ReadContentTypeHeader(Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue)
member.summary: Reads the requested API version from the HTTP Content-Type header.
member.param: The Content-Type header to read from.
member.returns: The API version read or null.

member.summary: Provides API version parameter descriptions supported by the current reader using the supplied provider.
member.param: The context used to add API version parameter descriptions.

member.name: T:Asp.Versioning.MediaTypeApiVersionReaderBuilder
member.content: Provides additional implementation specific to ASP.NET Core.
member.summary: Represents a builder for an API version reader that reads the value from a media type HTTP header in the request.

member.name: M:Asp.Versioning.MediaTypeApiVersionReaderBuilder.Template(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a template used to read an API version from a media type.
member.param: The template used to match the media type.
The optional name of the API version parameter in the template. If a value is not specified, there is expected to be a single template parameter.
member.remarks: The template syntax is the same used by route templates; however, constraints are not supported.

member.name: M:Asp.Versioning.MediaTypeApiVersionReaderBuilder.Parameter(System.String)
member.summary: Adds the name of a media type parameter to be read.
member.param: The name of the media type parameter.

member.name: M:Asp.Versioning.MediaTypeApiVersionReaderBuilder.Exclude(System.String)
member.summary: Excludes the specified media type from being read.
member.param: The name of the media type to exclude.

member.name: M:Asp.Versioning.MediaTypeApiVersionReaderBuilder.Include(System.String)
member.summary: Includes the specified media type to be read.
member.param: The name of the media type to include.

member.name: M:Asp.Versioning.MediaTypeApiVersionReaderBuilder.Match(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a pattern used to read an API version from a media type.
member.param: The regular expression used to match the API version in the media type.

member.name: M:Asp.Versioning.MediaTypeApiVersionReaderBuilder.Select(System.Func{Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpRequest,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.String},System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.String}})
member.summary: Selects one or more raw API versions read from media types.
member.param: The function used to select results.
member.remarks: The selector will only be invoked if there is more than one value.

member.summary: Creates and returns a new API version reader.

member.summary: Adds a function used to read the an API version from one or more media types.

member.name: M:Asp.Versioning.Routing.ApiVersionMatcherPolicy.RouteConstraintRegex
member.remarks:
Pattern:
{([^:]+):[^}]+}
Options:
RegexOptions.IgnoreCase | RegexOptions.Singleline
Explanation:
Match '{'.
1st capture group.
Match a character other than ':' atomically at least once.
Match ':'.
Match a character other than '}' atomically at least once.
Match '}'.

member.summary: Determines whether the route constraint matches the specified criteria.

member.name: T:Asp.Versioning.ApiVersioningOptions
member.summary: Represents the possible options for API versioning.

member.name: P:Asp.Versioning.ApiVersioningOptions.RouteConstraintName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name associated with the API version route constraint.
member.value: The name associated with the API version route constraint. The default value is "apiVersion".

member.name: P:Asp.Versioning.ApiVersioningOptions.ReportApiVersions
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether requests report the API version compatibility information in responses.
member.value: True if the responses contain API version compatibility information; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: When this property is set to true, the HTTP headers "api-supported-versions" and "api-deprecated-versions" will be added to all valid service routes. This information is useful for advertising which versions are supported and scheduled for deprecation to clients. This information is also useful when supporting the OPTIONS method.

member.name: P:Asp.Versioning.ApiVersioningOptions.AssumeDefaultVersionWhenUnspecified
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a default version is assumed when a client does does not provide an API version.
member.value: True if the a default API version should be assumed when a client does not provide an API version; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: When a default API version is assumed, the version used is based up the result from .

member.name: P:Asp.Versioning.ApiVersioningOptions.DefaultApiVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the default API version applied to services that do not have explicit versions.
member.value: The default API version. The default value is .

member.name: P:Asp.Versioning.ApiVersioningOptions.ApiVersionReader
member.summary: Gets or sets the API version reader.
member.value: An API version reader object. The default value is an instance of the .
member.remarks: The API version reader is used to read the API version specified by a client. The default value is the , which only reads the API version from the "api-version" query string parameter. Replace the default value with an alternate implementation, such as the , which can read the API version from additional information like HTTP headers.

member.name: P:Asp.Versioning.ApiVersioningOptions.ApiVersionSelector
member.summary: Gets or sets the API version selector.
member.value: An API version selector object. The default value is an instance of the .
member.remarks: The API version selector is used to select an appropriate API version when a client does not specify a version. The default value is the , which always selects the .

member.name: P:Asp.Versioning.ApiVersioningOptions.Policies
member.summary: Gets or sets the builder used for API versioning policies.
member.value: The API versioning policy builder.

member.name: P:Asp.Versioning.ApiVersioningOptions.UnsupportedApiVersionStatusCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTTP status code used for unsupported versions of an API.
member.value: The HTTP status code. The default value is 400 (Bad Request).

remarks.para: While any HTTP status code can be provided, the following are the most sensible:

item.description: The API doesn't support this version
